briefdescription.para: The cursor is represented as a UI element.

detaileddescription.para: See cursorGraphic.

briefdescription.para: If a native Mouse device is present, its cursor will be used and driven by the virtual mouse using Mouse.WarpCursorPosition.

detaileddescription.para: The software cursor referenced by cursorGraphic will be disabled.
Note that if no native Mouse is present, behavior will fall back to SoftwareCursor.

briefdescription.para: Determines how the cursor for the virtual mouse is represented.
Optional transform that will be updated to correspond to the current mouse position.

detaileddescription.para: Transform to update with mouse position.

This is useful for having a UI object that directly represents the mouse cursor. Simply add both the VirtualMouseInput component and an Image component and hook the RectTransform component for the UI object into here. The object as a whole will then follow the generated mouse cursor motion.

briefdescription.para: How many pixels per second the cursor travels in one axis when the respective axis from stickAction is 1.

detaileddescription.para: Mouse speed in pixels per second.

briefdescription.para: Determines which cursor representation to use.

detaileddescription.para: If this is set to CursorMode.SoftwareCursor (the default), then cursorGraphic and cursorTransform define a software cursor that is made to correspond to the position of virtualMouse. If this is set to CursorMode.HardwareCursorIfAvailable and there is a native Mouse device present, the component will take over that mouse device and disable it (so as for it to not also generate position updates). It will then use Mouse.WarpCursorPosition to move the system mouse cursor to correspond to the position of the virtualMouse. In this case, cursorGraphic will be disabled and cursorTransform will not be updated.
Whether the system mouse cursor (if present) should be made to correspond with the virtual mouse position.
Note that regardless of which mode is used for the cursor, mouse input is expected to be picked up from virtualMouse.
Note that if CursorMode.HardwareCursorIfAvailable is used, the software cursor is still used if no native Mouse device is present.

briefdescription.para: The UI graphic element that represents the mouse cursor.

detaileddescription.para: Graphic element for the software mouse cursor.
If cursorMode is set to CursorMode.HardwareCursorIfAvailable, this graphic will be disabled.

Also, this UI component implicitly determines the Canvas that defines the screen area for the cursor. The canvas that this graphic is on will be looked up using GetComponentInParent and then the Canvas.pixelRect of the canvas is used as the bounds for the cursor motion range.

briefdescription.para: Multiplier for values received from scrollWheelAction.

detaileddescription.para: Multiplier for scroll values.

briefdescription.para: The virtual mouse device that the component feeds with input.

detaileddescription.para: Instance of virtual mouse or null.

This is only initialized after the component has been enabled for the first time. Note that when subsequently disabling the component, the property will continue to return the mouse device but the device will not be added to the system while the component is not enabled.

briefdescription.para: The Vector2 stick input that drives the mouse cursor, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: Mouse.position on virtualMouse and the anchoredPosition on cursorTransform (if set).
Stick input that drives cursor position.
This should normally be bound to controls such as Gamepad.leftStick and/or Gamepad.rightStick.

briefdescription.para: Optional button input that determines when Mouse.leftButton is pressed on virtualMouse.

detaileddescription.para: Input for Mouse.leftButton.

briefdescription.para: Optional button input that determines when Mouse.rightButton is pressed on virtualMouse.

detaileddescription.para: Input for Mouse.rightButton.

briefdescription.para: Optional button input that determines when Mouse.middleButton is pressed on virtualMouse.

detaileddescription.para: Input for Mouse.middleButton.

briefdescription.para: Optional button input that determines when Mouse.forwardButton is pressed on virtualMouse.

detaileddescription.para: Input for Mouse.forwardButton.

briefdescription.para: Optional button input that determines when Mouse.forwardButton is pressed on virtualMouse.

detaileddescription.para: Input for Mouse.forwardButton.

briefdescription.para: Optional Vector2 value input that determines the value of Mouse.scroll on virtualMouse.

detaileddescription.para: Input for Mouse.scroll.
In case you want to only bind vertical scrolling, simply have a Composites.Vector2Composite with only Up and Down bound and Left and Right deleted or bound to nothing.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputActionProperty field, Action< InputAction.CallbackContext > callback, bool install=true)
memberdef.name: SetActionCallback

briefdescription.para: A component that creates a virtual Mouse device and drives its input from gamepad-style inputs.

detaileddescription.para: This effectively adds a software mouse cursor.

This component can be used with UIs that are designed for mouse input, i.e. need to be operated with a cursor. By hooking up the InputActions of this component to gamepad input and directing cursorTransform to the UI transform of the cursor, you can use this component to drive an on-screen cursor.

Note that this component does not actually trigger UI input itself. Instead, it creates a virtual Mouse device which can then be picked up elsewhere (such as by InputSystemUIInputModule) where mouse/pointer input is expected.
Also note that if there is a Mouse added by the platform, it is not impacted by this component. More specifically, the system mouse cursor will not be moved or otherwise used by this component.
